Def.Name: Scotch Pine
Def.Description: Evergreen standing 30' - 100' tall. Pyramidal when young, becoming round topped and irregular in age.
Def.Leaves: Needles occur in bunches of 2, are stout and usually twisted, 1" - 3" long, and bluish-green in color.
Def.Twigs: Green when young. Yellow-brown to olive-brown with large orangish buds when older.
Def.SeedConeOrFruit: 1 1/2" - 2 1/2" long, egg-shaped; pale yellow-brown; short-stalked; tip bent back.
Def.Bark: Reddish-brown, thin; becoming gray and shedding in papery or scaly plates.
Def.Range: Cold hardy to zone 2. Native to the Scottish Highlands, this is one of the most disributed pines of the world. Across Europe, Scandinavia and northern Asia; also Canada and northern United States.
Def.Remarks: Wind breaks and Chrismas tree plantations. Slow growing and long lived.
